articles.headline: China Plans Up to $200 Billion in Trade Concessions, but Skepticism Abounds
articles.snippet: A meeting between the top economic adviser to China and administration officials is expected to focus heavily on reducing the gap between what America exports to China and what it imports.
articles.abstract: A meeting between the top economic adviser to China and administration officials is expected to focus heavily on reducing the gap between what America exports to China and what it imports.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump, facing an economic war with China and a momentous meeting with North Korea, is considering a trade deal with Beijing that would soothe tensions and clear the way for his historic encounter with Kim Jong-un. But it would risk abandoning the president’s broader goal of punishing China for years of pressuring American companies to hand over sensitive technology.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler and Ana Swanson

articles.headline: Shari Redstone and Leslie Moonves Have Starring Roles in a Corporate War
articles.snippet: In the morning, a judge’s decision went against the CBS executive. Later in the day, there was a tense board meeting at the CBS Building.
articles.abstract: In the morning, a judge’s decision went against the CBS executive. Later in the day, there was a tense board meeting at the CBS Building.
articles.lead_paragraph: They were once allies, if not friends.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced and John Koblin

articles.headline: Show Starring Avenatti and Scaramucci Is Being Pitched to Television Executives
articles.snippet: The men are fixtures on cable news — Mr. Avenatti, the lawyer for a pornographic actress suing the president, as Mr. Trump’s antagonist, and Mr. Scaramucci as the president’s supporter.
articles.abstract: The men are fixtures on cable news — Mr. Avenatti, the lawyer for a pornographic actress suing the president, as Mr. Trump’s antagonist, and Mr. Scaramucci as the president’s supporter.
articles.lead_paragraph: A television show featuring Michael Avenatti, the lawyer who is suing President Trump on behalf of a pornographic film actress, and the former White House communications director Anthony Scaramucci was pitched to two cable networks in recent weeks, people briefed on the matter said on Thursday.
articles.byline: By Michael S. Schmidt and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: ‘Just the Grossest Thing’: Women Recall Interactions With U.S.C. Doctor
articles.snippet: Dozens of women have called a university hotline amid allegations of misconduct against a campus gynecologist, George Tyndall, that date to the 1990s.
articles.abstract: Dozens of women have called a university hotline amid allegations of misconduct against a campus gynecologist, George Tyndall, that date to the 1990s.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — He quipped about the looseness of a woman’s vagina. He remarked on the smoothness of another woman’s skin. He surprised one patient by suddenly removing her tampon and dangling it in front of her.

articles.headline: Suzanne Scott Named First Female Chief Executive of Fox News
articles.snippet: The appointment of Ms. Scott by the Murdoch family elevated an executive closely tied with the Roger Ailes regime that became mired in a sexual harassment scandal.
articles.abstract: The appointment of Ms. Scott by the Murdoch family elevated an executive closely tied with the Roger Ailes regime that became mired in a sexual harassment scandal.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Murdochs named Suzanne Scott the new chief executive of Fox News on Thursday, making her the first woman to lead the cable news network even as her appointment signaled the elevation of an executive closely tied with the old regime that was largely ousted in the wake of a sexual harassment scandal.
articles.byline: By Emily Steel and Michael M. Grynbaum

articles.headline: Critics Say He Can’t Beat a Dictator. This Venezuelan Thinks He Can.
articles.snippet: Henri Falcón vows to defeat President Nicolás Maduro in a vote that is a crossroads both for democracy in South America and for the fate of one of its countries.
articles.abstract: Henri Falcón vows to defeat President Nicolás Maduro in a vote that is a crossroads both for democracy in South America and for the fate of one of its countries.
articles.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela — If there is one thing that particularly irks Henri Falcón, it’s the suggestion that you can’t beat a dictatorship.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Casey and Ana Vanessa Herrero

articles.headline: Sanctions on Iran and Venezuela May Empower U.S. Rivals
articles.snippet: Squeezing the two oil producers could increase demand for Russian crude and offer China and Russia a chance to deepen their ties to the Iranians.
articles.abstract: Squeezing the two oil producers could increase demand for Russian crude and offer China and Russia a chance to deepen their ties to the Iranians.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — President Trump faces a difficult juggling act as he tries to persuade China, India and other countries to join in oil sanctions against Iran while also pressuring Venezuela.

articles.headline: Trump Administration to Tie Health Facilities’ Funding to Abortion Restrictions
articles.snippet: The change would bar the staff of reproductive health groups from providing abortions or referring patients to abortion clinics or risk losing federal family planning funds.
articles.abstract: The change would bar the staff of reproductive health groups from providing abortions or referring patients to abortion clinics or risk losing federal family planning funds.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Clinics that provide abortions or refer patients to places that do would lose federal funding under a new Trump administration rule that takes direct aim at Planned Parenthood, according to three administration officials.
articles.byline: By Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: In Texas School Shooting, 10 Dead, 10 Hurt and Many Unsurprised
articles.snippet: “I’ve always kind of felt like eventually it was going to happen here, too,” one student said after the massacre at Santa Fe High School.
articles.abstract: “I’ve always kind of felt like eventually it was going to happen here, too,” one student said after the massacre at Santa Fe High School.
articles.lead_paragraph: SANTA FE, Tex. — A nation plagued by a wrenching loop of mass school shootings watched the latest horror play out in this small Southeast Texas town Friday morning, as a young man armed with a shotgun and a .38 revolver smuggled under his coat opened fire on his high school campus, killing 10 people, many of them his fellow students, and wounding 10 more, the authorities said.
articles.byline: By Manny Fernandez, Richard Fausset and Jess Bidgood

articles.headline: ‘I’m American. I Hug.’ Meghan Markle’s Looming Impact on the British Monarchy
articles.snippet: For decades, traditionalists and modernizers have dueled inside Britain’s royal family. Ms. Markle, who marries Prince Harry on Saturday, could tip the balance.
articles.abstract: For decades, traditionalists and modernizers have dueled inside Britain’s royal family. Ms. Markle, who marries Prince Harry on Saturday, could tip the balance.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — As a harbinger of things to come for Meghan Markle, consider a scene from her early encounter with royal protocol: After her first few visits to see her boyfriend in Kensington Palace, she began greeting the palace guards with hugs.
